message.content:
We have to read all the “Interest Receivables” transactions and find the net change during the period. In our data the “Interest Receivables” rows all show positive amounts (because initially there is no balance). In a cash‐flow statement, an increase in a noncash asset (interest receivable in this case) is shown as a “decrease” in operating cash flows. 

Step‐by‐step we go through every “Interest Receivables” row:

1. On 2024‑01‑01 the Interest entry is 418.30  
2. On 2024‑01‑02 the entry is 418.30  
3. On 2024‑01‑03 the entry is 418.30  
4. 2024‑01‑04: 418.12  
5. 2024‑01‑05: 418.12  
6. 2024‑01‑06: 418.03  
7. 2024‑01‑07: 418.03  
8. 2024‑01‑08: 418.03  
9. 2024‑01‑09: 418.03  
10. 2024‑01‑10: 418.03  
11. 2024‑01‑11: 418.03  
12. 2024‑01‑12: 418.03  
13. 2024‑01‑13: 418.03  
14. 2024‑01‑14: 418.03  
15. 2024‑01‑15: 418.03  
16. 2024‑01‑16: 418.03  
17. 2024‑01‑17: 418.03  
18. 2024‑01‑18: 418.03  
19. 2024‑01‑19: 418.03  
20. 2024‑01‑20: 418.03  
21. 2024‑01‑21: 418.03  
22. 2024‑01‑22: 417.77  
23. 2024‑01‑23: 417.77  
24. 2024‑01‑24: 417.77  
25. 2024‑01‑25: 417.77  
26. 2024‑01‑26: 417.77  
27. 2024‑01‑27: 417.77  
28. 2024‑01‑28: 417.77  
29. 2024‑01‑29: 399.97  
30. 2024‑01‑30: 399.97  
31. 2024‑01‑31: 382.17  
32. 2024‑02‑01: 382.17  
33. 2024‑02‑02: 382.17  
34. 2024‑02‑03: 381.99  
35. 2024‑02‑04: 381.99  
36. 2024‑02‑05: 381.99  

When we add these amounts (rounding each to two decimals), we get approximately 14,796.43. (You can check the arithmetic by grouping and summing the amounts step‐by‐step.)

Since the beginning balance (at the start of the period) of Interest Receivable is zero, the ending balance is 14,796.43. An increase in a balance sheet asset means that even though the business “earned” interest, the cash was not received. Therefore, in the operating section of the cash flow statement this increase is shown as a reduction (a negative adjustment) to the net cash provided by operating activities.

Thus the final (Increase) Decrease in Interest Receivable is –14,796.43.

We then present the answer as required in JSON format:

--------------------------------------------------

{
  "solution": {
    "(Increase) Decrease in Interest Receivable": "-14796.43"
  }
}
